channel.title: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible
channel.description:
[size=40pt]I'M NOT HELPING ANYONE SO FUCK OFF WITH THE PERSONAL MESSAGES.[/size]
Hello there Moparscape. I'm `Lewk_, Usually known as P I M P 3 D Tut. (I got a username change) I'm going to show you probably the easiest way to portforward! Using one simple Program.
[i]Difficulty[/i]: 0/10 [i]Operating system required[/i]: None, Any will do fine. Programs needed: µTorrent
Let's get started. [center][b][size=19pt]Step One:[/size] FAQ What is µTorrent?[/b] µTorrent is a popular BitTorrent software. It is used for downloading torrents and such. It can also be used to portforward!
[b][size=19pt]Step Two:[/size] Required downloads[/b] You need the program µTorrent. It can be found at www.uTorrent.com Click the button that displays this: [url=http://utorrent.com/downloads/complete?os=win][IMG]http://i25.tinypic.com/2hdyz9v.jpg[/img][/url] (Click it if your using windows) Once your finished, Run the program. Install it. Depending on your system, It should be very quick. No restarts required.
[b][size=19pt]Step Three:[/size] Portforwarding[/b] After the fast installation, You should open up the program you just installed. By default, it would open by itself. When It's open, It should look like this. [IMG]http://i31.tinypic.com/15cxzl5.jpg[/img] (Without all the downloaded crap :p) Alright. Now, Start up your server. (Run.bat, Initialize.bat ect) MAKE SURE YOUR SERVER IS STARTED UP BEFORE YOU DO THIS NEXT STEP! Once your server is started up, Go into µTorrent and Press "Ctrl + P" (Like CTRL + F to search, Same idea) Once thats open, Go to the connections tab, And make your connections tab look like mine.. [IMG]http://i25.tinypic.com/19tv6o.jpg[/img] If the port your server uses is not 43594, Then change it. [/center]
That's pretty much all there is to it! If you have any trouble what so over doing this. Please, Post.
Thank you.
P.s. Doesn't work? Well guess what, You did it wrong. Do it again.

item.title: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible
item.dc:creator: @Doobage Doobage
item.description:
@Doobage wrote:

I see what he ment by this, SOME programs port forward on your router when ran, Bit torrent and U torrent are one of thsoe features, So is skype.

And using that as a port forward… Eh, It prob COULD work. COULD

but odds are your server would prob say (port 43594 is in use)

Read full topic

item.title: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible
item.dc:creator: @Luuck Luuck
item.description:
@Luuck wrote:

hey,
I did what this turtuorial says.
but first when i try to connect with the server it says : No Response, and now I have some ip’s changed, and now it says: error connecting to the server.
What more should I change so that others can connect with my server?

Read full topic
item.source: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible

item.title: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“Samih1996, post:286, topic:290170”][quote author=Lirimoo link=topic=383567.msg4159108#msg4159108 date=1352906792]
Noone can connect to my Server when i use uTorrent.
[/quote]
Dont use Utorrent, its crap. All you need is No-Ip because your ip will change regularly and using no ip you can keep your ip something like: gamename.no-ip.org

Operating system required: None, Any will do fine.

No OS?

Since the game is java, you will need java to host it. So you can run any operating system which can run your .bat file if you are using it and has java installed and is working.[/quote]You still need to forward your ports… and linux can’t run a .bat file but it can host a server.
Shut up unless you know what you’re talking about

Read full topic

item.description:
@Samih1996 wrote:

Lirimoo:

Noone can connect to my Server when i use uTorrent.

Dont use Utorrent, its crap. All you need is No-Ip because your ip will change regularly and using no ip you can keep your ip something like: gamename.no-ip.org

PvPXile:

[quote]Operating system required: None, Any will do fine.

No OS?[/quote]
Since the game is java, you will need java to host it. So you can run any operating system which can run your .bat file if you are using it and has java installed and is working.

item.title: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible
item.dc:creator: @Samih1996 Samih1996
item.description:
@Samih1996 wrote:

[quote=“Lirimoo, post:282, topic:290170”]But how to host a Server with it ?
When i try to connect to my Server it Says NO RESPONSE.
Even im connecting with 127.0.0.1.
Other players cant connect too.
Please help :/[/quote]
The guys that want to connect to you can only use the ip which is displayed from your computer at ipchicken.com, 127.0.0.1 is called a local ip, its the same as 0.0.0.0, You connect to your own computer. To portforward i would recommend you use portforward.com because this tutorial isn’t that good. If you have trouble using the website link i’ve given then you could look up tutorials on how to use the website.

Read full topic

Don’t be silly, it can’t. It can be done with MOST. some router’s cannot portforward, i.e. mines. Before you try n state it can, i’ve looked up its specs it can’t portforword ( if you would like the model inbox me).

please state most.

item.source: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible

item.title: Can't portforward? Look here! Easiest way possible
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

I have been trying to portforward for about 5 hours now. Could someone let me know if I’m missing anything as I believe I’ve done quite literally everything possible 3 or 4 times over. My operating system is Windows 7.

-I have disabled my Norton anti-virus.
-I have made TCP and UDP, inbound and outbound, exceptions for the port 43594 via Windows 7 Firewall.
-I have made inbound and outbound exceptions for the program NO-IP DUC 3.0 via Windows 7 Firewall.
-I have accessed my router. It is a 2Wire 2701HG-B
-I created a new port exception via the router for port 43594, TCP and UDP.
-I added the port exception to the relative field in my router.
-I downloaded uTorrent. Ran my server first. Had NO-IP running… CTRL + P… Made an exception for port 43594, only having the Windows Firewall and Enable NAT-PMP port mapping boxes checked. It made an exception in my Firewall.
-I disabled my Firewall competely.

After every step, I checked http://www.canyouseeme.org and it always said connection refused or connection timed out.

Am I missing something vital out?

Read full topic
